for_sales.sales_text: Ariel is a Heard 18.5 Tosher. She served her role to introduce the younger members of the family to the joys of sailing just for fun. Perhaps she served her role too well as I have now lost my crew to dinghy sailing. While the crew hone their sailing skills in dinghy sailing, I will allow Ariel to fulfil her role for another family, while I seek a new project. Ariel underwent a refit as outlined on her website and subsequent posts. Ariel is a joy to sail with the family or single handed, she will be sorely missed. The large open spacious cockpit is ideal for fun trips with the kids and their pals. I have enjoyed Ariel and her stability so much that the next project will I hope also be a Heard built boat, ideally Heard 23. Ariel has a racing rig with 3 head sail sizes [Storm, Working and Racing]. As Ariel is an open boat an automatic bilge pump was fitted with 12 V battery in the bilge. The 12 V battery allowed for a VHF and navigation lights. Ariel currently lies on a custom built 4 wheel trailer under cover of a PVC tarpaulin in Greystones Co. Wicklow, Ireland. The trailer is braked and un-sprung. I tow the boat and trailer using a 1.9 diesel VW Passat without any difficulty. Should Ariel find a new home in the UK or further afield I am happy to assist with the ferry crossing. I would tow the boat to the ferry and travel with the boat to the UK based ferry port [Hollyhead, Liverpool, Pembroke or Fishguard] for a hand over to the new custodian. An option to keep the towing weight to a minimum would be to ship the Pig Iron ballast, warps rigging anchor etc. via a courier as a pelleted shipment. This would reduce the towing weight by over 800 Kg making the towing will within the limits of a family car. If a prospective custodian wishes to view the boat I am more than happy to pick them up at the airport and drop them back after the viewing. I live circa 40 minutes from the airport. Storm, Working and racing Jib and Staysail are all if good working order - Topsail in good working order - Standing rigging was replaced with new SS in 2015 - Running rigging all in good working order - Anchor with 6M of chain and 10M anchor line - 4 fenders with 2 mooring lines - Automatic bilge pump with 12 V battery - Custom built 4 wheel trailer - PVC tarpaulin with Boom Cover - beaching legs - Oars and Oar locks

An attractive example of this iconic Falmouth working boat and trailer sailer. Comes with road trailer. Arielle is in very good order having been loved and carefully maintained by its current and previous owners as a cutter rigged sailing boat. She is an excellent day boat being equally manageable single handed or as a 'day out' family boat and has proved herself a safe and deft performer under sail in all the various seas the Solent has thrown at her. Outboard available by separate negotiation. Located in Lymington, Hampshire

boat.full_description:
In 2016, her owner asserted that Ariel's sole purpose was for family fun and adventure, a role that a Tosher is ideally suited for. When purchased in 2013, the boat needed a refit. In summary, the refit included:

Floor Boards and Cockpit Sole

Sheer Capping and Rubbing Stake

Keel Band

Undiscovered stuff

Back in the water after the refit, her owner asserts, "The boat is so well behaved that we take long trips with a young family and 'Ariel' takes good care of us. Ariel is a joy to sail with the family or single handed, she will be sorely missed. The large open spacious cockpit is ideal for fun trips with the kids and their pals. I have enjoyed Ariel and her stability so much that the next project will I hope also be a Heard built boat, ideally Heard 23."

Ariel won the Solent OGA Annual Race in 1990 and her class the previous year.

In 1991, when advertised for sale in Gaffers Log, the owner stated: "This boat may be plastic but with over a ton of ballast she sails and behaves like the real thing. She carries over 300 sq. ft. of sail and is a very exciting little boat." At this time she was lying Bosham and the asking price was £2,250.

Ariel changed hands in 2018, and was brought back to the Solent from Ireland. To reflect this, her name was changed from Ariel of Greystones to Arielle of Keyhaven
boat.name: Arielle of Keyhaven
boat.short_description: Ariel is a Heard Tosher, she won the Solent Gaffers Annual Race in 1990.
